result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Fredrick Lavon Blackshire was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Order for Placement, signed and filed.

Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing for Conditional Release Proceeded.  State and defense approve the proposed conditional release plan.  Court finds that conditional release would not pose a significant risk either of bodily harm to the defendant or to others, or of serious property damage.  Court approves the conditional release plan.  Defendant is committed to the Department of Health Services for 3 years, with credit for 360 days credit.   Court does not believe that an Order for involuntary medication is necessary.
Order for Commitment signed and filed.  Copies given to Sheriff's Department, and emailed to Ms. Brown at WCS.
Conditional Release Plan dated January 22, 2016 received and filed.
for Conditional Release Plan, signed and filed

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  WCS Forensic Specialist Tewana Marshall appears.    Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense is requesting a condition release plan heard.  Court orders a conditional release plan.   Court ordered case adjourned for conditional release hearing in Branch 19.  Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
dated 12/10/2015 from Teewana Marshall MA, received and filed
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $1062.50 to Dr. Pankiewicz for services on 09/22, 23, 24, 25  of 2015

Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  
As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed and read in.

As to Count 1:
Phase I
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint and Dr Pankewicz report dated 9-28-2015  as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  In Phase I Court found defendant guilty of Count 1.
Phase II
Parties have stipulated to the report by Dr. Pankewicz. Court finds based on Dr. Pankewicz's report that the defendant suffers from a mental disease or defect and as a result the defendant lacked substantial mental capacity to understand the wrongfulness of his conduct and is therefore found NOT GUILTY by reason of mental disease.  Court orders defendant committed to DHS.  Case adjourned for hearing to determine whether defendant is to be institutionalized or released on conditions and for how long.
Court orders DHS to conduct a predisposition investigation.
Order for Commitment, signed and filed
Order for Predisposition Investigation, signed and filed
Court adjourned for disposition hearing in Branch 19.  Hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Doctor's report supports an NGI finding.  Court grants defense request to schedule a bench trial in Branch 19.  Defense waives the first phase.  Waiver of jury trial to be taken by the court at the next court date.  Court trial scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Dr. Pankiewicz report dated 9/28/15, received and filed

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  A doctor's report has not been filed.  The appointed Dr. Kathleen Hayes was an intern in the Forensics department and is not there any more.  Court issued a new Order for Examination under 971.16 appointing Dr. Pankiewicz.  Order, signed and filed.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Br. 19.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense however for reasons stated on the record requested a not guilty by reason of insanity evaluation.  Court granted the defense request.  Defendant was not in court today, but will be at the next court appearance to enter a special plea.  Order for Examination under 971.16 signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 22.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in custody.  Ronald Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary hearing time limit waived.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription, and take all medication as prescribed.  Mental health supervision.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case adjourned from preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Competency Hearing proceeded.  State and defense do not challenge the report.  Court finds the defendant is competent to and reinstates the proceedings.
DHS Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for competency hearing.  Defendant refuses to leave his cell.  State and Defense do not challenge the report.  The Court found defendant DOES LACK THE COMPACITY TO UNDERSTAND COURT PROCEEDINGS.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  The Court further found that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication for the mental condition.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is combative and not cooperating with coming to court.  Under 971.14(4)(b) case is set for hearing on doctors report with Dr. Pankiewicz.  Defendant will be in court via video conference for the next court date.  Remand continues.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Forensic Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Fredrick Lavon Blackshire in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.   Court ordered time limits tolled for Preliminary Hearing.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
